title: Orientation of dipole moments in nail

content.question: An unmagnetized iron nail is held next to a bar magnet, as shown above. After a long time, the nail becomes magnetized. What is the predominant orientation of the magnetic dipole moments in the magnetized nail?

choices.label: Along the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, with north toward the top of the page
Along the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, with north toward the bottom of the page
Along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, with north toward the right of the page
Along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, with north toward the left of the page

content.answer: Along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, with north toward the left of the page

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
